definitions.definition: to be hurt, damaged, or destroyed by fire or extreme heat, or to cause this to happen:
examples: He was badly burned in the blaze.

definitions.definition: to cause emotional pain or damage to someone
to kill someone by tying the person to a post and burning them
to completely destroy a building by fire:
examples: The building was burned to the ground ten years ago.

definitions.definition: a place where fire or heat has hurt or damaged something:
examples: One rescue worker caught in the explosion sustained severe burns.
